profile_data.summary: I have done some work on robotics. I have some basic experience on working with humanoid robots, old-aided robot, underwater robots and wheeled robots. My primary job is on the platform developing and debugging tool developing at first. With the projects going on, I have worked with PCB design and debugging, Linux kernel modification and robot control software. Now, I am working on a blind navigation project which use Google Glass to help blind people walk in indoor environment.
profile_data.headline: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

experience.description: I am currently working on building digital twin system and developing the algorithms for health caring robot manipulator.
experience.title: Associate Researcher

experience.description: I played as a software engineer role in this internship period. I have done the development of the robot software on Industrial computer and the robot diagnose software with C#.
experience.title: Software Engineer

education.fieldOfStudy: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

education.description: I have done over 10 projects that is related to computer vision, object detection and robotics. I have plenty experience on developing algorithm and software for robot system.
education.fieldOfStudy: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

honors.description: I won the national prize in the first year of pursuing my master degree.
honors.title: National Prize

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
Project: Laser Beam Projection Based AR (Augmented Reality) for Construction Assistance
• Developed the laser projector prototype with Wi-Fi connectivity, RealSense, and microphone functionalities.
• Developed on-device firmware to support laser driver, Wi-Fi transmission, and image and voice collection.
• Developed a laser projection (AR) algorithm based on observed scenes and architectural plans.
• Developed a SmartCam vest for construction workers with work recording and quality certification.
• Developed an LLM (ChatGPT 4) assistant to prompt the worker on current workflow.
Project: Remote Accessible Nursing Assistive Robot
• Developed an assistive nursing robot to help nurses care for patients who cannot take care of themselves.
• Developed an algorithm that assists and cooperates with nurses based on their actions while providing care
for immobilized patients.
• Develop algorithms for a quadruped robot with a robot arm to patrol indoors and deliver objects.
• Integrate ChatGPT 4 into the robot controller for enhanced cooperation with patients.
projects.title: Post-doc in Tickle college of Engineer, UTK

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Developed a teleoperated cobot (collaborative robot) using VR (HTC Vive) for task demonstration and data collection.
• Proposed an explicit reinforcement learning method to generate optimal trajectories from the  demonstrated task trajectories.
• Proposed a reinforcement mimic learning network that utilizes extracted optimal demonstration trajectories to generate task trajectories for task completion.
• Explored the integration of visual observations to evaluate task completion, with the goal of reducing human effort during the task teaching process.
projects.title: Teach Robot Manipulator to Learn Manipulating Tasks

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Designed and implemented the control software and user API for a 6-degree-of-freedom robot manipulator.
• Designed and implemented a comprehensive robot diagnostic and analysis software (digital signal generator, digital Oscilloscope, and feedback data analyser, etc).
projects.title: Software Engineer Internship at Aubo Robotics

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Transformed a 2014 Nissan Leaf into an autonomous vehicle by integrating a comprehensive sensing (IMU, RGB camera, and thermal camera) and computing system(Jetson TX2, and a GTX 1080 powered laptop). 
• Constructed an autonomous driving simulator utilizing Carla and Autoware.
• Proposed a method for vehicle detection under challenging weather and lighting conditions by utilizing both RGB and thermal cameras.
projects.title: L2 Level Autonomous Driving Project

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Proposed a novel approach to split objects within the same class without using bounding box detection.
• Proposed a stacked adjacent relevance map network to evaluate the adjacent connection relationship.
projects.title: Panoptic Segmentation with Stacked Adjacent Relevance Map

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Proposed a pixel-pixel relevance network to determine the ownership of the lane markings.
• Conducted an ablation study to evaluate the performance using different backbones.
• Deployed the algorithm into a vehicle infotainment system.
projects.title: Lane Detection using Pixel-Pixel Relevance Map

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Built an LED calibration board that can be used for both thermal and RGB cameras.
• Improved the marker location estimation by fitting the LED data with a 2D Gaussian distribution.
projects.title: Spatial Calibration for Thermal-RGB Camera and Inertial Sensor

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Proposed a method for measuring the motion of a moving rigid body by utilizing a visual-inertial sensor.
• Established the dynamics constraint to elucidate the relation between scene depth and translational motion.
projects.title: Relative Motion Estimation with Visual-Inertial Sensor

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Proposed a novel algorithm to address the issue of scale information loss.
• Formulated the optimization function based on pixel depth and transformation estimations, following the minimum total variation rule.
projects.title: Real-scale Dense Depth estimation with Monocular Camera and IMU

member.occupation: Computer vision and machine learning for robotics

projects.description:
• Constructed a prototype of a head-mounted camera-IMU sensor bundle.
• Developed a robust ego-motion tracking algorithm in feature scarcity indoor environments.
• Proposed a complementary method to compensate for the interrupted or discontinuous image estimations
projects.title: Wearable ego-motion tracking for blind navigation in indoor environments
